titleStmt.title: The speech (without an oath) of Philip Herbert, late Earl of Pembrooke, at his admittance (as a Member) into the honorable House of Commons in Parliament assembled, April the 6th, 1649 After he had been duely elected a burgess for Bark-shire, instead of Sir Francis Pile, lately deceased. Taken verbatim by Michael Oldisworth. Printed in the year 1649.
titleStmt.author: Pembroke, Philip Herbert, Earl of, 1584-1650.

titleStmt.title: The speech (without an oath) of Philip Herbert, late Earl of Pembrooke, at his admittance (as a Member) into the honorable House of Commons in Parliament assembled, April the 6th, 1649 After he had been duely elected a burgess for Bark-shire, instead of Sir Francis Pile, lately deceased. Taken verbatim by Michael Oldisworth. Printed in the year 1649.
titleStmt.author: Pembroke, Philip Herbert, Earl of, 1584-1650.
Oldisworth, Michael, 1591-1654?

notesStmt.note: Incorrectly identified as Wing O257 at reel position 1236:1.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery ("Early English books, 1641-1700" reel 1236), and the Bodleian Library (reel 1893).
